marketNews.title: BI Holds Interest Rate Amid Rupiah Weakening
marketNews.content:
Bank Indonesia on Wednesday (18/12) decided to keep the BI Rate at 6% while the deposit facility and lending facility were maintained at 5.25% and 6.75% respectively. The decision matched consensus expectations. Governor Perry Warjiyo said the move was taken amid high global economic uncertainty, especially regarding U.S. policy direction and escalating geopolitical tensions in various regions. Perry noted that this uncertainty has driven a stronger U.S. dollar, with the DXY index up +1.2% month-to-date to 107 on Wednesday (18/12) as capital flows shifted to the United States.

The BI Rate hold is also linked to a narrowing of U.S. rate-cut space after former President Trump’s victory. According to the CME FedWatch Tool, the probability of a U.S. rate cut of ≥75 bps by June 2025 fell from 62.7% (5/11) before Trump’s win to 37.1% on Wednesday (18/12).

The macro backdrop pushed the rupiah down –1.5% month-to-date to IDR 16,090 per dollar. Nevertheless, Perry believes the rupiah remains relatively contained and expects it to stay stable given BI’s commitment to stability, attractive government bond yields, low inflation and solid growth prospects.

Key Takeaway: A more hawkish rate sentiment has spurred capital outflows from the IDX, with net foreign outflows of IDR 10.1 trillion over the past month to 17 December 2024. Meanwhile, Indonesian government bond yields have generally risen. The situation can be used by investors to lock in higher yields, such as PBS032 (1.5-year maturity) offering 6.76% yield or FR0076 (23-year maturity) offering 7.12% yield.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports Slowing Credit Growth to 10.79% YoY in 11M24
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that bank credit growth slowed to +10.79% year-on-year in the first eleven months of 2024 (versus +10.92% in the first ten months). Credit growth was driven by investment loans (+13.77% YoY), working-capital loans (+8.92% YoY) and consumer loans (+10.94% YoY). Sharia financing grew +11.24% YoY and MSME credit rose +4.02% YoY. BI projects overall credit growth in 2024 to stay around the 10-12% target range and to rise to 11-13% in 2025.

marketNews.title: Government to Reduce UMKM Tax Threshold to IDR 3.6 Billion
marketNews.content: The Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, said the government plans to lower the turnover threshold for micro, small and medium enterprises (UMKM) to qualify for the final income tax regime from the current IDR 4.8 billion per year to IDR 3.6 billion per year. The proposal is based on a recommendation from the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD).

marketNews.title: Indonesia’s Renewable Energy Mix Projected at 14.1% by End-2024
marketNews.content: The Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, said the renewable energy mix from new renewable power plants is expected to reach 14.1% of total generation by December 2024 (versus 13.09% in 2023), still far from the 23% target for 2025. Cumulative investment in the renewable energy sector since the start of 2024 has reached US$1.49 billion, achieving only 57.3% of the 2024 target of US$2.6 billion.

marketNews.title: Honda and Nissan Explore Merger, Possible Inclusion of Mitsubishi
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Honda Motor Co. (TYO: 7267) and Nissan Motor Co. (TYO: 7201) are exploring a possible merger. Honda Executive Vice President Shinji Aoyama told Bloomberg the companies are considering options including a merger, capital tie-up or the creation of a new holding company. Bloomberg added that the plan could also involve Mitsubishi Motors Corp. (TYO: 8058), which has a capital link with Nissan. If completed, the deal would create two major Japanese automotive groups: a Honda-Nissan-Mitsubishi bloc and a Toyota bloc.

marketNews.title: HRTA Targets 10-15 New Stores in 2025, Down from 2024 Goal
marketNews.content: Director Hartadinata Abadi ($HRTA) CEO Thendra Chrisnanda said the company targets the opening of about 10-15 new stores in 2025, down from the 2024 target of 20 new stores. He said HRTA will be more selective in store expansion as it faces challenges next year, including a VAT increase to 12%.

marketNews.title: CBRE Wins Time-Charter Contract for 57,000-DWT Vessel
marketNews.content: Cakra Buana Resources Energi ($CBRE) secured a time-charter contract for one 57,000-DWT supramax bulk carrier from PT Sys Petrolindo Utama. The contract is valued at IDR 145 million per day for five years, with an option to extend for a further two years.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Purchases 91.7 Million SCMA Shares
tickerNews.content: $SCMA: Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK) bought 91.7 million SCMA shares at an average price of IDR 180.5 per share on 16-17 December 2024. The transaction value was IDR 16.6 billion. After the deal, EMTK’s ownership in SCMA rose from 61.32% to 61.44%. This is EMTK’s fourth SCMA purchase since early December 2024, following purchases of 87 million (0.12%) shares on 4-5 December, 68 million (0.09%) on 6-9 December and 100 million (0.14%) on 11 December.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Increases Stake in SCMA to 61.44%
tickerNews.content: $EMTK: The same transaction described above (91.7 million SCMA shares at IDR 180.5) increased EMTK’s stake in SCMA to 61.44% from 61.32%.

tickerNews.title: KKGI Announces IDR 15 Interim Dividend
tickerNews.content: $KKGI: Resource Alam Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend of IDR 15 per share. The cum-date is the regular market on 30 December 2024 with payment on 17 January 2025. Based on the closing price of IDR 525 on 18 December 2024, the implied dividend yield is 2.9%.

tickerNews.title: Sight Investment Increases Stake in SILO to 63.45%
tickerNews.content: $SILO: Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd. bought 982,500 SILO shares at an average price of IDR 2,850 per share on 16 December 2024, valuing the deal at roughly IDR 2.8 billion. After the transaction, Sight’s ownership rose from 63.44% to 63.45%. This is the second SILO purchase by Sight in December 2024 after a US$1.05 billion (8.04%) purchase on 11 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Sells 389,752 t CO₂e Carbon Credits, Plans 320 MW Geothermal Project
tickerNews.content: $PGEO: Pertamina Geothermal Energy announced the sale of 389,752 tonnes CO₂e of carbon credits from PLTP Lahendong Unit 5 & 6 (Volume 3) to its subsidiary PT Pertamina Power Indonesia (PPI). Net profit from the transaction is US$755,000 (approximately IDR 12.4 billion). In a separate information disclosure, PGEO said it is ready to drill geothermal wells in the WKP Seulawah Agam, Aceh Besar, together with PT Pembangunan Aceh. The project, with a potential 320 MW geothermal capacity, is in land-acquisition preparation with drilling slated for 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBCA to Appoint Gregory Hendra Lembong as New President Director
tickerNews.content: $BBCA: Katadata reported that Deputy President Director of Bank Central Asia, Gregory Hendra Lembong, is set to replace Jahja Setiatmadja as President Director of BBCA. The source also said Jahja will replace Djohan Emir Setijoso as President Commissioner of BBCA. Djohan submitted his resignation on 16 December 2024; the resignation will be discussed at the 2025 AGM. BBCA has not commented on the matter.

tickerNews.title: TOBA Secures US$15 Million Credit Facility and US$23.3 Million Solar Loan
tickerNews.content: $TOBA: TBS Energi Utama signed a credit facility of up to US$15 million, comprising up to US$5 million from PT Bank DBS Indonesia and up to US$10 million from the Asian Development Bank. The funds will be used to finance subsidiaries PT Energi Kreasi Bersama and PT Manufaktur Kreasi Bangsa for an integrated electric-vehicle ecosystem. In a separate disclosure, PT Nusantara Tembesi Baru Energi, the TOBA entity, signed a US$23.3 million loan from PT Sarana Multi-Infrastructure to fund a 42 MW floating solar power plant in Batam, Riau Islands.
